place.name: TROSTRE
place.gazetteerText: TROSTREY, a parish in Pontypool district, Monmouth; 2¾ miles NNW of Usk r. station. Post town, Usk, under Newport, Monmouth. Acres, 1,255. Real property, £1,684. Pop., 190. Houses, 39. T. Hall is the seat of Sir S. Fludyer, Bart. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £72. Patron, Sir S. Fludyer, Bart. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
